description:
Erection of a detached, basement and two storey house with
rooms in the roof,
As shown on drawing numbers; 571/AP7/01, 02a, 03b, 04, 05,
06a, 07, 08, 09a. Letter dated 26th October 2000 and method
statement (revised 25th October 2000) relating to the
demolition and construction works in relation to existing
horse chestnut tree.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Before the development hereby permitted is commenced,
    samples of materials including a brick panel to be viewed on
    site, roof tiles, window and door frames including colour
    and finish, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by
    the local planning authority. The development shall be
    carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 2 - Before the development hereby permitted is commenced,
    detailed drawings at a scale of 1:20 and/or 1:5 shall be
    submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning
    authority in respect of: joinery details; the bay/oriel
    window; roof construction to the single storey section
    adjacent to 5 Holford Road, including lanterns; and the
    basement ventilation grille at ground level. The development
    shall be carried out in accordance with the approved
    details.

Condition : 3 - Before the development hereby permitted has commenced, full
    details of hard and soft landscaping and any further means
    of enclosure of any part of the applications site shall be
    submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning
    authority. All hard and soft landscaping works shall be
    carried out in accordance with the approved landscape
    details by the end of the planning season that follows the
    completion of the development.

Condition : 4 - Within 12 metres of the centre of the horse chestnut tree,
    the basement foundations hereby permitted shall not extend
    beyond the ground floor footprint of the building shown on
    the approved drawings. With the exception of the roof eaves
    overhang shown on the approved drawings, no part of the
    building hereby permitted shall be constructed within 8
    metres of the centre of the horse chestnut tree.

Condition : 5 - Before the development hereby permitted is commenced and
    notwithstanding the information on the approved drawings,
    the size and location of roof lights shall be submitted to
    and approved in writing by the local planning authority. All
    roof lights shall be of the "conservation type", lying
    within the zone of the approved construction and not
    projecting above the roof finish.
Condition : 6 - All rainwater goods shall be of cast iron and painted black.

Condition : 7 - Before the development hereby permitted is commenced,
    detailed arrangements for the transportation of building
    plant, equipment, goods and materials to and from the site
    and their storage on site, shall be submitted to and
    approved in writing by the local planning authority. The
    development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with
    the approved arrangements.

Condition : 8 - Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and
    Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 1995
    or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order, no
    development within Part 1 (Class A-H) and Part 2 (Class A-C)
    shall be carried out.

Condition : 9 - At one metre outside the windows of any habitable rooms in
    neighbouring properties, the level of noise emanating from
    all plant and machinery on the appeal site shall be at all
    times not less than 5 decibels below existing background
    noise levels, expressed in dB(A), at such locations. Where
    the noise emanating from plant and machinery on the appeal
    site is tonal in character, that noise shall be not less
    than 10 dB(A) below existing background noise levels at
    those locations.

Condition : 10 - Within six weeks of it becoming apparent to the developer or
    the local planning authority before or during the
    construction of the development hereby permitted that works
    of repair are necessary to the site boundary walls, a method
    statement describing how those works will be undertaken
    shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local
    planning authority. The works shall be implemented in strict
    accordance with the agreed method statement.

Condition : 11 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in
    strict accordance with the approved plans, or any variation
    thereof agreed in writing by the local planning authority
    pursuant to any other condition attached to this permission.

Condition : 12 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN16 and EN33 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 13 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN16 and EN33 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 14 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of
    visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the
    requirements of policy EN17 + EN40 of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 15 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the
    development will not have an adverse effect on existing
    trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities
    of the area in accordance with the requirements of policy
    EN81 + EN40 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary
    Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 16 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN16 and EN33 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 17 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN16 and EN33 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 18 - To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to
    safeguard amenities of adjacent premises in accordance with
    the requirements of policy TR23 of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 19 - To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to prevent
    over development of the site by controlling proposed
    extensions and alterations in order to ensure compliance
    with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN33 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 20 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in order to ensure compliance with the
    requirements of policy RE* of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 21 - To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the
    character of the immediate area in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1 and EN16 + EN33 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 22 - To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the
    character of the immediate area in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1 and EN16 + EN33 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 23 - The details required pursuant to Additional Condition(s) 1,
    2, 3, 5, 7 and 10. should be submitted with the attached
    approval of details application form together with 6 sets of
    drawings and any other supporting information. They will be
    considered by this authority in conjunction with the
    Historic Buildings and Monuments Commission (London
    Division).
